data:
Two parallel benches, 45 and 47.5m in length, set out in a north-south direction at a distance of 10m separation. 
                                    The more easterly bench is designated 'B' by the excavators; the more westerly, 'A'. Each bench is subdivided into two sections, 
                                    with a seat divider / arm-rest at the end of each section. The inscription is set out over all four sections, beginning at the northern end of Bench B (line 1), 
                                    proceeding to the southern end of B (line 2), and then continuing on the southern part of Bench A (line 3), and on to the northern section of Bench A (line 4).
The second half of the second bench (i.e. the northern section of Bench A) is in the courtyard at the entrance to the museum; the rest remains in situ in the gymnasium.
I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana
Comprehensive collection of archaeological material discovered at the site of Agrigento and in Agrigento province, organised both by chronology and type across a number of rooms and corridors
Contrada San Nicola, 12 Valley of the Temples, 92100 - Agrigento (AG)
L'année épigraphique: revue des publications épigraphiques relatives a l'antiquité romaine.

‘L’année épigraphique: revue des publications épigraphiques relatives a l’antiquité romaine.’, L’année épigraphique : revue des publications épigraphiques relatives a l’antiquité romaine., 1888, http://www.worldcat.org/oclc/630058599
P. Griffo, «Ancora su due epigrafi agrigentine», Sicilia Archeologica 59 (1985): 53–64
La ginnasiarchia nelle "poleis" dell'occidente mediterraneo antico
G. Cordiano, La ginnasiarchia nelle «poleis» dell’occidente mediterraneo antico, Studi e testi di storia antica 7 (Pisa, 1997)
Acragas Graeca: die historische Topographie des griechischen Akragas auf Sizilien. 1, Historischer Teil

Two parallel benches, 45 and 47.5m in length, set out in a north-south direction at a distance of 10m separation. The more easterly bench is designated 'B' by the excavators; the more westerly, 'A'. Each bench is subdivided into two sections, with a seat divider / arm-rest at the end of each section. The inscription is set out over all four sections, beginning at the northern end of Bench B (line 1), proceeding to the southern end of B (line 2), and then continuing on the southern part of Bench A (line 3), and on to the northern section of Bench A (line 4).

sandstone seat chiselled Line 1 Interlineation line 1 to 2 Agrigentum Agrigento 37.32084, 13.58876 After Fiorentini, Augustan (specifically 2 BCE — 14 CE) Gymnasium37.293628, 13.586525 The second half of the second bench (i.e. the northern section of Bench A) is in the courtyard at the entrance to the museum; the rest remains in situ in the gymnasium. 2018.09.12 Prag
